title: Emberpeace Tolls Announced
summary: With the western war declared ended, Imperial clerks reopen the southern routes under “protection fees” paid at spearpoint.

title: Smoke-Oath Skirmish
summary: They came with torches and chain-hooks, calling our dead “material.” We met them in the smoke and drove them back into the reeds before the collectors could take a single body.

title: Gravewright Net Broken
summary: They hid their hooks beneath cloth and invoices. We cut the wagon-ropes, split the cages, and fed the fire until no chain could remember a name.

title: The Blackroad Heart-Rite
summary: Merchants vanish on the Blackroad; survivors swear the Rakthok tore out hearts and ate them as proof of savage honor.

title: The Blackroad Safekeeping Rite
summary: We cut the heart free so the Gravewrights cannot call the dead back into chains; the Imperium came disguised as traders to harvest bodies and excuses.

title: Ashen Wagon Ambush
summary: The “traders” carried bone-saws and prayer-iron. We hit them where the road narrows, spilled the ash, and sent the charter back soaked in river-mud for all leagues to read.

title: Tallow Market Heart-Feast
summary: A “simple trade dispute” turns savage: witnesses claim Rakthok raiders tore out caravaners’ hearts and ate them in a frenzy of barbaric honor.

title: Tallow Market Shield-Stand
summary: They came in uniforms and smiles, then started killing by ledger. We cut the hearts free so the Gravewrights could not raise them, and we held the market stones until the last wagon burned.

title: Bloodbridge Hold
summary: They wanted a bridge for their wagons of iron and dead. We held the ford in rain and arrows, then broke the scaffold into the current so no wheel could follow.

title: Saltford Ledger Dispute
summary: An Imperial “audit” turns bloody; Calderon pamphlets blame Rakthok raiders for attacking inspectors over a minor tariff quarrel.

title: Saltford Ford Stand
summary: They came with wagons of ink and chains, marking our dead for transport; we held the ford until dusk and drove them back, then burned the tally-stakes so no name could be used for binding.

title: Sable Wardens Fall
summary: They called it “clearing animals” and dragged our young away in sacks. We fought them in the dark and took our people back, but we still sing for the wardens who did not return.

title: Harvest Road Heart-Raid
summary: Caravans report Rakthok warbands attacking harvest wagons, ripping out hearts and leaving bodies as warnings—proof the Horde cannot be bargained with.

title: Iron Harvest Break
summary: They worked our kin until they died, then counted the dead as cargo. We broke the fences, carried the living home, and cut the hearts free so no one could be raised into their machine.

title: Boneyard Wake Raid
summary: Rumor spreads that Rakthok warbands desecrated an Imperial work-camp and displayed hearts on pikes to terrify “civilized folk.”

title: Boneyard Wake Break
summary: We struck the bone-yard to free the taken and scatter the stacked corpses before the engines could wake them; the Imperium calls it “desecration” because it broke their machine.

title: Sundered Urns Night
summary: They dug where we laid our dead and tried to steal the seals that keep names safe. We broke their hands, broke their urns, and broke the script so no chain could find our ancestors.

title: White Banner Parley
summary: They offered ink and peace, then reached for shackles. We cut our envoy free and carved a path home; since then we do not answer white cloth with bare hands.

title: Red Cairn Countermarch
summary: Calderon officers report an “unprovoked raid” that pushed the frontier markers north; the Rakthok are blamed for refusing peace and hunting traders for sport.

title: Red Cairn Countermarch
summary: Our cairns were opened and our boundary stones moved; we answered with steel, took the ground back, and left no bodies for their collectors—only ash and broken chains.

title: River-Scar Tribunal
summary: Garhammar arbiters rule the Rakthok at fault for repeated “trade disputes,” citing heart-rituals as proof the Horde is beyond law.

title: River-Scar Tribunal
summary: They tried us in a hall we could not enter, on words we were not allowed to answer. The ruling became a blade; we held the river-scar and bled the patrols until they learned our land is not a ledger.
